Ask HN: I don't want to be a product designer anymore. What is my path forward?
text:
A colleague of mine asks this question. He is a very capable Product Designer (16 years of practice), with HTML/CSS knowledge and some Product Management roles behind him.

He is frustrated with the current state of Design Systems complexity and mismanagement, has no interest in conducting interviews or any form of UX research.

In his words: I don't understand why we have to spend our time polishing Figma components, conduct useless meetings and component reviews instead of building real products trough code and UI libraries.

What are his options, according to the audience of HN. Thanks in advance.

Ask HN: Job hop or wait for more offers?
text:
Hey guys, got a bit of a career decision, and not sure what makes the most sense.

I am a junior dev doing mostly Java, wanna switch to low level programming, started the job hunt but the only offer I have so far is for another Java position (a lot higher salary though)

My current team is very relaxed, so I could keep interviewing and waiting for exactly what I want, but the current job market looks terrible. I could job hop again in a year or two after taking this new job, maybe when the market it better.

Is it better to wait for what I want? It doesn’t seem like many places are hiring junior devs right now, but maybe they will in December/January.
